device.description:
[code][root@newton ~]# lspci -nnk 03:01.0 PCI bridge [0604]: Adaptec (formerly DPT) PCI Bridge [1044:a500] (rev 02) 03:01.1 I2O [0e00]: Adaptec (formerly DPT) SmartRAID V Controller [1044:a501] (rev 02) Subsystem: Adaptec (formerly DPT) 2400A UDMA Four Channel [1044:c05a] Kernel driver in use: PCI_I2O Kernel modules: i2o_core[/code]
[code][root@newton ~]# lspci -vmmnn Device: 03:01.1 Class: I2O [0e00] Vendor: Adaptec (formerly DPT) [1044] Device: SmartRAID V Controller [a501] SVendor: Adaptec (formerly DPT) [1044] SDevice: 2400A UDMA Four Channel [c05a] Rev: 02 ProgIf: 01[/code]

device.model_name: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic MegaRAID SAS 2108 [Liberator] (rev 05)
device.description:
lspci -nnk [code]02:00.0 RAID bus controller [0104]: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic MegaRAID SAS 2108 [Liberator] [1000:0079] (rev 05) Subsystem: Intel Corporation RAID Controller RS2BL040 [8086:9260] Kernel driver in use: megaraid_sas Kernel modules: megaraid_sas [/code]
lspci -vmmnn [code]Slot: 02:00.0 Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic [1000] Device: MegaRAID SAS 2108 [Liberator] [0079] SVendor: Intel Corporation [8086] SDevice: RAID Controller RS2BL040 [9260] Rev: 05 [/code]
lspci -v [code]02:00.0 RAID bus controller: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic MegaRAID SAS 2108 [Liberator] (rev 05) Subsystem: Intel Corporation RAID Controller RS2BL040 Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 0, IRQ 17 I/O ports at 3000 [size=256] Memory at c1180000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=16K] Memory at c1140000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=256K] Expansion ROM at c1100000 [disabled] [size=256K] Capabilities: <access denied> Kernel driver in use: megaraid_sas Kernel modules: megaraid_sas[/code]

[code]lspci -nnpk 00:1f.2 RAID bus controller [0104]: Intel Corporation 82801 SATA Controller [RAID mode] [8086:2822] (rev 02) [/code]
[code]lspci -vmmnn Slot: 00:1f.2 Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: Intel Corporation [8086] Device: 82801 SATA Controller [RAID mode] [2822] SVendor: Intel Corporation [8086] SDevice: Device [514d] Rev: 02
[/code]

[p]lspci -nnpk[/p] [code]00:1f.1 RAID bus controller [0104]: ULi Electronics Inc. ULi 5287 SATA [10b9:5287] (rev 02)[/code] [p]lspci -vmmnn[/p] [code]Slot: 00:1f.1 Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: ULi Electronics Inc. [10b9] Device: ULi 5287 SATA [5287] SVendor: ASUSTeK Computer Inc. [1043] SDevice: Device [8056] Rev: 02 [/code]

device.model_name: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic SAS2008 PCI-Express Fusion-MPT SAS-2 [Falcon] (rev 03)
device.description:
lspci -nnpk [code]0d:00.0 Serial Attached SCSI controller [0107]: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic SAS2008 PCI-Express Fusion-MPT SAS-2 [Falcon] [1000:0072] (rev 03)[/code]
lspci -vmmnn [code]Slot: 0d:00.0 Class: Serial Attached SCSI controller [0107] Vendor: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic [1000] Device: SAS2008 PCI-Express Fusion-MPT SAS-2 [Falcon] [0072] SVendor: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic [1000] SDevice: Device [3050] PhySlot: 3 Rev: 03[/code]
lspci -v [code]0d:00.0 Serial Attached SCSI controller: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic SAS2008 PCI-Express Fusion-MPT SAS-2 [Falcon] (rev 03) Subsystem: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic Device 3050 Physical Slot: 3 Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 0, IRQ 24 I/O ports at 9000 [size=256] Memory at df03c000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=16K] Memory at df040000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=256K] Expansion ROM at df080000 [disabled] [size=512K] Capabilities: [50] Power Management version 3 Capabilities: [68] Express Endpoint, MSI 00 Capabilities: [d0] Vital Product Data Capabilities: [a8] MSI: Enable+ Count=1/1 Maskable- 64bit+ Capabilities: [c0] MSI-X: Enable- Count=15 Masked- Capabilities: [100] Advanced Error Reporting Capabilities: [138] Power Budgeting <?> Capabilities: [150] Single Root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV) Capabilities: [190] Alternative Routing-ID Interpretation (ARI) Kernel driver in use: pciback Kernel modules: mpt2sas[/code]

device.model_name: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic MegaRAID SAS 2008 [Falcon] (rev 03)
device.description:
The adapter has GNU/Linux drivers on the accompanying CD, but probably not 100% free.
[p]lspci -nnk[/p] [code]01:00.0 RAID bus controller [0104]: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic MegaRAID SAS 2008 [Falcon] [1000:0073] (rev 03) Subsystem: Intel Corporation RAID Controller RS2WC080 [8086:9240] Kernel driver in use: megaraid_sas Kernel modules: megaraid_sas [/code]
lspci -vmmnn [code]Slot: 01:00.0 Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic [1000] Device: MegaRAID SAS 2008 [Falcon] [0073] SVendor: Intel Corporation [8086] SDevice: RAID Controller RS2WC080 [9240] Rev: 03 [/code]
lspci -v [code]01:00.0 RAID bus controller: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic MegaRAID SAS 2008 [Falcon] (rev 03) Subsystem: Intel Corporation RAID Controller RS2WC080 Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 0, IRQ 16 I/O ports at e000 [size=256] Memory at f7e60000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=16K] Memory at f7e00000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=256K] Expansion ROM at f7e40000 [disabled] [size=128K] Capabilities: <access denied> Kernel driver in use: megaraid_sas Kernel modules: megaraid_sas [/code]

device.model_name: Integrated Technology Express, Inc. IT8212 Dual channel ATA RAID controller (rev 13)
device.description:
[p]This fake RAID adapter is integrated on the [b]Gigabyte GA-I945PL-G[/b] motherboard.[/p]
[p]lspci -nnk[/p] [code]04:06.0 RAID bus controller [0104]: Integrated Technology Express, Inc. IT8212 Dual channel ATA RAID controller [1283:8212] (rev 13) Subsystem: Integrated Technology Express, Inc. IT/ITE8212 Dual channel ATA RAID controller [1283:0001] Kernel driver in use: pata_it821x Kernel modules: pata_it821x [/code]
lspci -vmmnn [code]Slot: 04:06.0 Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: Integrated Technology Express, Inc. [1283] Device: IT8212 Dual channel ATA RAID controller [8212] SVendor: Integrated Technology Express, Inc. [1283] SDevice: IT/ITE8212 Dual channel ATA RAID controller [0001] Rev: 13 [/code]
lspci -v [code]04:06.0 RAID bus controller: Integrated Technology Express, Inc. IT8212 Dual channel ATA RAID controller (rev 13) Subsystem: Integrated Technology Express, Inc. IT/ITE8212 Dual channel ATA RAID controller Flags: bus master, 66MHz, medium devsel, latency 64, IRQ 22 I/O ports at 9410 [size=8] I/O ports at 9800 [size=4] I/O ports at 9c10 [size=8] I/O ports at a000 [size=4] I/O ports at a400 [size=16] [virtual] Expansion ROM at 80020000 [disabled] [size=128K] Capabilities: [80] Power Management version 2 Kernel driver in use: pata_it821x Kernel modules: pata_it821x [/code]

device.model_name: Intel Corporation 82801 Mobile SATA Controller [RAID mode] (rev 04)
device.description:
[b]lspci -vnnmm[/b] [code]Slot: 00:1f.2 Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: Intel Corporation [8086] Device: 82801 Mobile SATA Controller [RAID mode] [282a] SVendor: Hewlett-Packard Company [103c] SDevice: Device [179b] Rev: 04 [/code]
[b]lspci -nnk[/b] [code]00:1f.2 RAID bus controller [0104]: Intel Corporation 82801 Mobile SATA Controller [RAID mode] [8086:282a] (rev 04) Subsystem: Hewlett-Packard Company Device [103c:179b] Kernel driver in use: ahci[/code]

device.model_name: VIA Technologies, Inc. VT6421 IDE/SATA Controller (rev 50)
device.description: [b][p]lspci -vnnmm[/p][/b] [p][/p] [p]Slot: 05:07.0[/p] [p]Class: RAID bus controller [0104][/p] [p]Vendor: VIA Technologies, Inc. [1106][/p] [p]Device: VT6421 IDE/SATA Controller [3249][/p] [p]SVendor: Fujitsu Technology Solutions [1734][/p] [p]SDevice: Device [10ac][/p] [p]Rev: 50[/p] [p][/p] [b][p]lspci -nnk[/p][/b] [p][/p] [p]05:07.0 RAID bus controller [0104]: VIA Technologies, Inc. VT6421 IDE/SATA Controller [1106:3249] (rev 50)[/p] [p] Subsystem: Fujitsu Technology Solutions Device [1734:10ac][/p] [p] Kernel driver in use: sata_via[/p] [p] Kernel modules: sata_via[/p]

device.model_name: Intel Corporation 6 Series/C200 Series Chipset Family SATA RAID Controller (rev 05)
device.description: [p]lspci -nnpk[/p] [code]00:1f.2 RAID bus controller [0104]: Intel Corporation 6 Series/C200 Series Chipset Family SATA RAID Controller [8086:1c04] (rev 05)[/code] [p]lspci -vmmnn[/p] [code]Slot: 00:1f.2 Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: Intel Corporation [8086] Device: 6 Series/C200 Series Chipset Family SATA RAID Controller [1c04] SVendor: Intel Corporation [8086] SDevice: Device [7270] Rev: 05 [/code] [p]lspci -v[/p] [code]00:1f.2 RAID bus controller: Intel Corporation 6 Series/C200 Series Chipset Family SATA RAID Controller (rev 05) Subsystem: Intel Corporation Device 7270 Flags: bus master, 66MHz, medium devsel, latency 0, IRQ 21 I/O ports at 4090 [size=8] I/O ports at 4080 [size=4] I/O ports at 4070 [size=8] I/O ports at 4060 [size=4] I/O ports at 4020 [size=32] Memory at c1b40000 (32-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=2K] Capabilities: <access denied> Kernel driver in use: megasr Kernel modules: megasr, ahci [/code]

If the controller has already been configured, existing units can be accessed using the 3w-9xxx driver. However, there are currently no free software tools for checking the status of the drives, assigning drives to units, creating/destroying/migrating units, or configuring the many advanced features of the controller.

device.model_name: SiI 0649 Ultra ATA/100 PCI to ATA Host Controller

device.description: lspci -vvvnnk [code] 03:00.0 IDE interface [0101]: VIA Technologies, Inc. VT6415 PATA IDE Host Controller [1106:0415] (prog-if 85 [Master SecO PriO]) Subsystem: ASUSTeK Computer Inc. Motherboard [1043:838f] Control: I/O+ Mem+ BusMaster+ SpecCycle- MemWINV- VGASnoop- ParErr- Stepping- SERR- FastB2B- DisINTx- Status: Cap+ 66MHz- UDF- FastB2B- ParErr- DEVSEL=fast >TAbort- <TAbort- <MAbort- >SERR- <PERR- INTx- Latency: 0, Cache Line Size: 64 bytes Interrupt: pin A routed to IRQ 16 Region 0: I/O ports at e040 [size=8] Region 1: I/O ports at e030 [size=4] Region 2: I/O ports at e020 [size=8] Region 3: I/O ports at e010 [size=4] Region 4: I/O ports at e000 [size=16] Expansion ROM at f7d00000 [disabled] [size=64K] Capabilities: [50] Power Management version 3 Flags: PMEClk- DSI- D1+ D2+ AuxCurrent=0mA PME(D0-,D1+,D2+,D3hot+,D3cold-) Status: D0 NoSoftRst- PME-Enable- DSel=0 DScale=0 PME- Capabilities: [70] MSI: Enable- Count=1/1 Maskable+ 64bit+ Address: 0000000000000000 Data: 0000 Masking: 00000000 Pending: 00000000 Capabilities: [90] Express (v1) Legacy Endpoint, MSI 00 DevCap: MaxPayload 128 bytes, PhantFunc 0, Latency L0s <64ns, L1 <1us ExtTag- AttnBtn- AttnInd- PwrInd- RBE+ FLReset- DevCtl: Report errors: Correctable- Non-Fatal- Fatal- Unsupported- RlxdOrd- ExtTag- PhantFunc- AuxPwr- NoSnoop- MaxPayload 128 bytes, MaxReadReq 512 bytes DevSta: CorrErr- UncorrErr- FatalErr- UnsuppReq- AuxPwr- TransPend- LnkCap: Port #0, Speed 2.5GT/s, Width x1, ASPM L0s L1, Exit Latency L0s <1us, L1 <64us ClockPM- Surprise- LLActRep- BwNot- LnkCtl: ASPM Disabled; RCB 64 bytes Disabled- CommClk- ExtSynch- ClockPM- AutWidDis- BWInt- AutBWInt- LnkSta: Speed 2.5GT/s, Width x1, TrErr- Train- SlotClk- DLActive- BWMgmt- ABWMgmt- Capabilities: [100 v1] Advanced Error Reporting UESta: DLP- SDES- TLP- FCP- CmpltTO- CmpltAbrt- UnxCmplt- RxOF- MalfTLP- ECRC- UnsupReq- ACSViol- UEMsk: DLP- SDES- TLP- FCP- CmpltTO- CmpltAbrt- UnxCmplt- RxOF- MalfTLP- ECRC- UnsupReq- ACSViol- UESvrt: DLP+ SDES+ TLP- FCP+ CmpltTO- CmpltAbrt- UnxCmplt- RxOF+ MalfTLP+ ECRC- UnsupReq- ACSViol- CESta: RxErr- BadTLP- BadDLLP- Rollover- Timeout- NonFatalErr- CEMsk: RxErr- BadTLP- BadDLLP- Rollover- Timeout- NonFatalErr+ AERCap: First Error Pointer: 14, GenCap+ CGenEn- ChkCap+ ChkEn- Capabilities: [130 v1] Device Serial Number 00-40-63-ff-ff-63-40-00 Kernel driver in use: pata_via [/code]

device.model_name: Silicon Image, Inc. SiI 3114 [SATALink/SATARaid] Serial ATA Controller (rev 02)
device.description:
lspci -nnpk [code]05:0a.0 RAID bus controller [0104]: Silicon Image, Inc. SiI 3114 [SATALink/SATARaid] Serial ATA Controller [1095:3114] (rev 02)[/code]
lspci -vmmnn [code]Class: RAID bus controller [0104] Vendor: Silicon Image, Inc. [1095] Device: SiI 3114 [SATALink/SATARaid] Serial ATA Controller [3114] SVendor: ASUSTeK Computer Inc. [1043] SDevice: A8N-SLI Deluxe/Premium Mainboard [8167] Rev: 02 [/code]
lspci -v [code]05:0a.0 RAID bus controller: Silicon Image, Inc. SiI 3114 [SATALink/SATARaid] Serial ATA Controller (rev 02) Subsystem: ASUSTeK Computer Inc. A8N-SLI Deluxe/Premium Mainboard Flags: bus master, 66MHz, medium devsel, latency 32, IRQ 19 I/O ports at 9000 [size=8] I/O ports at 9400 [size=4] I/O ports at 9800 [size=8] I/O ports at 9c00 [size=4] I/O ports at a000 [size=16] Memory at d4018000 (32-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=1K] Expansion ROM at d3000000 [disabled] [size=512K] Capabilities: [60] Power Management version 2 Kernel driver in use: sata_sil [/code]

device.model_name: Intel Corporation C600/X79 series chipset SATA RAID Controller (rev 05)
device.description:
[code][b]lspci -d 8086:2826 -nnpk[/b][/code] [code]00:1f.2 RAID bus controller [0104]: Intel Corporation C600/X79 series chipset SATA RAID Controller [8086:2826] (rev 05)[/code]

[/code]

device.model_name: Intel Corporation Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller (AHCI mode) (rev 21)
device.description:
[b]N.B. As of May 2018, drives connected to this controller are not "seen" by default in RedHat-based distros, during installation.[/b]
[b][code]lspci -nnk[/code][/b] [code]00:17.0 SATA controller [0106]: Intel Corporation Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller [AHCI mode] [8086:9d03] (rev 21) Subsystem: Intel Corporation Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller [AHCI mode] [8086:2068] Kernel driver in use: ahci Kernel modules: ahci[/code]
[b][code]lspci -vmmnn[/code][/b] [code]Slot: 00:17.0 Class: SATA controller [0106] Vendor: Intel Corporation [8086] Device: Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller [AHCI mode] [9d03] SVendor: Intel Corporation [8086] SDevice: Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller [AHCI mode] [2068] Rev: 21 ProgIf: 01[/code]
[b] [code]lspci -nnpk[/code][/b] [code]00:17.0 SATA controller [0106]: Intel Corporation Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller [AHCI mode] [8086:9d03] (rev 21)[/code]
[b][code]lspci -v[/code][/b] [code]00:17.0 SATA controller: Intel Corporation Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller [AHCI mode] (rev 21) (prog-if 01 [AHCI 1.0]) Subsystem: Intel Corporation Sunrise Point-LP SATA Controller [AHCI mode] Flags: bus master, 66MHz, medium devsel, latency 0, IRQ 129 Memory at dc348000 (32-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=8K] Memory at dc34c000 (32-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=256] I/O ports at f090 [size=8] I/O ports at f080 [size=4] I/O ports at f060 [size=32] Memory at dc34b000 (32-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=2K] Capabilities: [80] MSI: Enable+ Count=1/1 Maskable- 64bit- Capabilities: [70] Power Management version 3 Capabilities: [a8] SATA HBA v1.0 Kernel driver in use: ahci Kernel modules: ahci[/code]

N.B. As of May 2018, NVME drives of this type are not "seen" by default in RedHat-based distros, during installation (at lest on Intel NUC7i3BNHXF)
[b][code]lspci -nnk[/code][/b] [code]3c:00.0 Non-Volatile memory controller [0108]: Intel Corporation Device [8086:2522] Subsystem: Intel Corporation Device [8086:3806] Kernel driver in use: nvme Kernel modules: nvme[/code]
[b][code]lspci -nnpk[/code][/b] [code]3c:00.0 Non-Volatile memory controller [0108]: Intel Corporation Device [8086:2522][/code]
[b][code]lspci -vmmnn[/code][/b] [code]Slot: 3c:00.0 Class: Non-Volatile memory controller [0108] Vendor: Intel Corporation [8086] Device: Device [2522] SVendor: Intel Corporation [8086] SDevice: Device [3806] ProgIf: 02 NUMANode: 0[/code] [b] [code]lspci -v[/code][/b] [code]3c:00.0 Non-Volatile memory controller: Intel Corporation Device 2522 (prog-if 02 [NVM Express]) Subsystem: Intel Corporation Device 3806 Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 0, IRQ 16, NUMA node 0 Memory at dc010000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=16K] Memory at dc000000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=64K] Capabilities: [40] Power Management version 3 Capabilities: [50] MSI-X: Enable+ Count=9 Masked- Capabilities: [60] Express Endpoint, MSI 00 Capabilities: [a0] MSI: Enable- Count=1/16 Maskable+ 64bit+ Capabilities: [100] Advanced Error Reporting Capabilities: [150] Virtual Channel Capabilities: [180] Power Budgeting <?> Capabilities: [190] Alternative Routing-ID Interpretation (ARI) Capabilities: [2a0] #19 Capabilities: [2d0] Latency Tolerance Reporting Capabilities: [310] L1 PM Substates Kernel driver in use: nvme Kernel modules: nvme[/code]
